intro: Viola andrasovszkyi, commonly known as the Andrasovszky viola, is a species of flowering plant in the Violaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan. This perennial herb features heart-shaped leaves and produces delicate, violet-colored flowers with yellow centers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
